Bases: causalinference.core.data.Dict

Bases: causalinference.core.data.Dict

Dictionary-like class containing treatment effect estimates for each estimator used.

causalinference.estimators.matching module¶

class causalinference.estimators.matching.Matching(data, W, m, bias_adj)¶

Bases: causalinference.estimators.base.Estimator

Dictionary-like class containing treatment effect estimates. Standard errors are only computed when needed.

Methods

causalinference.estimators.matching.bias(X, X_m, matches, coefs)¶

Computes bias correction term, which is approximated by the dot product of the matching discrepancy (i.e., X-X_matched) and the coefficients from the bias correction regression.

causalinference.estimators.matching.bias_coefs(matches, Y_m, X_m)¶

Computes OLS coefficient in bias correction regression. Constructs data for regression by including (possibly multiple times) every observation that has appeared in the matched sample.

causalinference.estimators.matching.calc_atc_se(vars_c, vars_t, scaled_counts_t)¶
causalinference.estimators.matching.calc_ate_se(vars_c, vars_t, scaled_counts_c, scaled_counts_t)¶
causalinference.estimators.matching.calc_att_se(vars_c, vars_t, scaled_counts_c)¶
causalinference.estimators.matching.calc_atx_var(vars_c, vars_t, weights_c, weights_t)¶
causalinference.estimators.matching.match(X_i, X_m, W, m)¶
causalinference.estimators.matching.norm(X_i, X_m, W)¶
causalinference.estimators.matching.scaled_counts(N, matches)¶

Counts the number of times each subject has appeared as a match. In the case of multiple matches, each subject only gets partial credit.

causalinference.estimators.matching.smallestm(d, m)¶

Finds indices of the smallest m numbers in an array. Tied values are included as well, so number of returned indices can be greater than m.
